articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's acting President Choi Sang-mok said on Tuesday he would immediately move to fill vacancies on the Constitutional Court in a effort to restore stability after the impeachment of two of his predecessors this month triggered political turmoil.
articles.title: South Korea's acting President Choi to appoint two Constitutional Court justices

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean court on Tuesday approved an arrest warrant for President Yoon Suk Yeol, who has been impeached and suspended from power over his decision to impose martial law on Dec. 3, investigating authorities said.
articles.title: South Korea court issues arrest warrant for President Yoon

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Reuters spoke to four Palestinian men detained by Israel since the war’s outbreak. All were held for months, accused of affiliating with an illegal organisation, and released without being formally charged or convicted of any crime.
articles.title: Amid ceasefire push, Palestinians bear the scars of Israeli detention

articles.author: Raphael Satter, A.J. Vicens
articles.description: Chinese state-sponsored hackers breached the U.S. Treasury Department's computer security guardrails this month and stole documents in what Treasury called a "major incident," according to a letter to lawmakers that Treasury officials provided to Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: US Treasury says Chinese hackers stole documents in 'major incident'

articles.author: Jonathan Allen, Brad Brooks
articles.description: The official six-day state funeral for Carter begins on Saturday as his remains travel by motorcade through his hometown of Plains, Georgia.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter funeral service to be held at Washington National Cathedral on Jan 9

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Khalil Ashawi, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syria's new rulers have installed some foreign fighters including Uyghurs, a Jordanian and a Turk in the country's armed forces as Damascus tries to shape a patchwork of rebel groups into a professional military, two Syrian sources said.
articles.title: Syria appoints some foreign Islamist fighters to its military, sources say

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: Experts said the embankment's proximity to the end of the runway defied best practices.
articles.title: Questions over airport embankment, bird strikes as South Korea air crash probed

articles.author: Jose Torres
articles.description: Hundreds of migrants waited in long lines outside an immigration office in southern Mexico on Monday, hoping to secure safe passage north and enter the U.S. legally before President-elect Donald Trump takes office in January.
articles.title: Migrants in Mexico anxious to enter US legally before Trump ends humanitarian programs

articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: Jimmy Carter, the earnest Georgia peanut farmer who as U.S. president struggled with a bad economy and the Iran hostage crisis but brokered peace between Israel and Egypt and later received the Nobel Peace Prize for his humanitarian work, died at his home in Plains, Georgia, on Sunday, the Carter Center said. He was 100.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter, former US president and Nobel Peace Prize recipient, dead at 100

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian military intelligence said on Tuesday one of its naval drones had destroyed a Russian helicopter and damaged another one in the Black Sea.
articles.title: Ukraine says naval drone destroys Russian helicopter for first time
